card_1.cardText:
First Primary Contests of 2018
==============================

Midterm election season kicks off TODAY in TEXAS

TAP HERE FOR MORE

card_2.cardText:
TX Early Voters Broke Records This Year
---------------------------------------

*   Texas voter turnout is usually low.
*   Ex: TX ranked 47th in voter turnout in the 2016 presidential election.
*   By Friday, at the end of the early voting, more than 885k Texans (52% Dems & 48% Reps) had cast their ballots – up more than 50% since the 2014 midterm primary elections.

card_3.cardText:
Why Texas Matters:
------------------

Texas had the nationas LARGEST annual population growth during every year from 2010 to 2016.

In 2017, Texas gained just about 400,000 residents.

**More Texans \*MEANS\*** **More Electoral Votes**

Why This Matters

card_4.cardText:
As the population of Texas grows, so does its sway over presidential elections
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Texas stands to gain as many as THREE Electoral College votes, bringing its total to 41.

Current Electoral College Votes: California (55) Florida (29) Illinois (20) New York (29) Ohio (18)
